==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𠊍}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|王|呂|亼|no_och3=-|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=s|c3=p|t1=upside-down axe|t2=two blocks of metal}}. {{lang|zh|亼}} is the ancient form for {{och-l|今}}.

===Etymology===
“Copper” {{defdate|prior to 5th {{BCE}}}} > “metals in general” > “gold”.

The main senses now are “gold” and “metal”.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かな}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かな}}. Appears to be the older form of this word. In modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, only found at the start of compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かな}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|かな}}

# [[metal]]
# [[money]]
# [[firmness]], [[strength]]
# [[completely]], [[entirely]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|金山|かなやま}}: a [[mine]] (for mineral extraction)
* {{ja-r|金床|かなとこ}}, {{ja-r|鉄床|かなとこ}}, {{ja-r|鉄砧|かなとこ}}: an [[anvil]]
* {{ja-r|金具|かなぐ}}: [[hardware]], [[metal]] [[fittings]]
* {{ja-r|金串|かなぐし}}: a [[metal]] [[skewer#Noun|skewer]] or [[spit#Noun|spit]]
* {{ja-r|金轡|かなぐつわ}}: a [[metal]] [[bit]] (as for a horse's mouth); [[hush]] money, a [[bribe]]
* {{ja-r|金槌|かなづち}}: a [[metal]] [[hammer]]
* {{ja-r|鉄棒|かなぼう}}: a [[metal]] [[rod]] or [[staff]]
* {{ja-r|金網|かなあみ}}: a [[metal]] [[mesh]], [[net]], or [[screen]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かね}}

Appears to be a fusion of ''kana'' + {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かね}} emphatic nominal particle {{ja-l|い||i}}. Compare the development of modern ''kami'' from ''kamu'' + ''i'' at {{ja-l|神}}, ''te'' from ''ta'' + ''i'' at {{ja-l|手}}, ''me'' from ''ma'' + ''i'' at {{ja-l|目}}, ''kaze'' from ''kaza'' + ''i'' at {{ja-l|風}}.

{{IPAchar|/kana/}} + {{IPAchar|/i/}} → {{IPAchar|/*kanai/}} → {{IPAchar|/kane/}}

The four kanji spellings of this term, {{lang|ja|金}} (“gold”), {{m|ja|銀||silver}}, {{m|ja|銅||copper}}, and {{m|ja|鉄||iron}}, hint at the importance of each of these four metals in ancient Japan.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かね|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|銀}}, {{ja-l|銅}}, {{ja-l|鉄}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かね}}

# [[money]]
#: ⇒ {{ja-l|お金||okane}}
# [[metal]]

=====Usage notes=====
The {{lang|ja|金}} spelling is the most common for this term.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|money}} {{ja-r|お金|おかね}}
* {{sense|metal}} {{ja-r|金属|きんぞく}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|銅|あかがね}}: [[copper]]
* {{ja-r|鋇|あつがね}}: [[barium]]
* {{ja-r|鉱|あらがね}}: [[ore]], [[unrefined]] [[metal]]
* {{ja-r|鉄|くろがね}}: [[iron]]
* {{ja-r|銀|しろがね}}: [[silver]]
* {{ja-r|鑽|たがね}}: [[chisel]]
* {{ja-r|鋼|はがね}}, {{ja-r|鑌|はがね}}: [[steel]]
* {{ja-r|水銀|みずがね}}, {{ja-r|汞|みずがね}}: [[mercury]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くがね}}

Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=くがね|黄|tr1=ku|t1=yellow|金|tr2=kane|t2=metal}}. The ''ku'' is a variation of regular {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|''kun'yomi''}} of ''ki'' for the {{ja-l|黄}} character.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=くがね|kane|gane}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くがね}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|黄金}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くがね}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=くがね|archaic}} [[gold]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|こがね}}
{{IPAchar|/kugane/}} → {{IPAchar|/kogane/}}

Alteration of ''kugane''<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>, possibly influenced by metaphor from {{m|ja|小金|tr=kogane||a small amount of money}}, or by the {{l|ja|sc=Latn|漢音|''kan'on''}} reading of ''kō'' for the {{ja-l|黄}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|こがね|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|acc2=1|acc2_ref=NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|黄金}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こがね}}

# [[gold]]
# [[gold]] or [[metal]] [[currency]]: [[coin]]s, such as {{m|ja|大判|tr=ōban}} or {{m|ja|小判|tr=koban}}
# short for {{m|ja|黄金色|tr=kogane iro||gold|pos=the color}}
# short for {{m|ja|黄金の泥|tr=kogane no dei||golden mud|pos=gold dust suspended in an emulsion and used for painting or other decoration}}
#: ⇒ {{ja-l|金泥||kondei}}

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|小金|こがね}}: a small amount of [[money]]
* {{ja-r|金泥|こんでい}}: “golden mud”, gold dust suspended in an [[emulsion]] and used for painting or other decoration

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|きん}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きん}} {{m|ltc|金|tr=</i>{{IPAchar|/kim/}}}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|金|tr=jīn}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|きん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きん}}

# [[gold]] (Au)
# [[money]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''金'''一封をもらった。|'''きん''' いっぷう を もらった。|I received a gift of '''money'''.}}
# [[metal]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=きん|shogi}} short for {{m|ja|金将|tr=kinsho||the gold general|pos=a [[w:Shogi|shogi]] piece}}
# one of the [[five]] [[classical]] [[elements]] in traditional Chinese [[philosophy]] and [[medicine]]: see the [[w:Wu Xing|"Wu Xing" entry on Wikipedia]]
